data.name: Windows 95 Product Key Validator
data.description:
## Story
It's the year 1997 and you are working at a computer workshop when suddenly Jim, your old fellow, rushes to you with a computer in his hands and a CD under his armpit. He said: "My company wants me to get Windows 95 installed on this machine. I don't know how to install it. Can you help me?". You nod your head, place his PC on your workbench, and start installing. Mid-installation the computer asks for the product key. Unfortunately, Jim doesn't have a product key with him, but you've known how the licensing system works for years.

## How the algorithm works
The product key looks like: ```xxxxxxxxxxx```

The dash will sepreate the key into 2 sections: first 3 characters (section 1) and last 7 characters (section 2)

If section 1 isn't equal to 333, 444, 666, 777, 888 or 999, it's valid.

Section 2 must be numeric and the sum of it's digits must be divisible by 7 to be valid

If any of the conditions mentioned above is not valid, the key is not valid

Note: keys will ```always``` have a length of 10 characters and the 4th x is not checked
## Task
Write function `validate_key()` that accepts an argument `key`, returns `True` if the key is valid, `False` otherwise
